medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presents with a 3-day history of periumbilical abdominal pain that has worsened compared to baseline, which includes intermittent mild abdominal pain due to IBS and GERD. The pain is crampy and has shown no improvement over the past few days. Associated symptoms include nausea, leading to hesitance in taking in significant oral intake. Pain intensity has improved after receiving Tylenol in the ED. The patient reports one similar episode last year that self-resolved without medical attention.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Right trochanteric bursitis, Irritable bowel syndrome, fibromyalgia, GERD, benign thyroid nodules, obstructive sleep apnea, H. pylori, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, atypical chest pain, palpitations, cervical radiculopathy.
